name: Cheddar and Mushroom Baked Scallops
author: COOKINKELLY
summary: A different way to bake scallops, with a cheese sauce.
ingredients: 1 ⅓ cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
½ cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
directions: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Melt 2 teaspoons butter in a large, oven proof skillet over medium-high heat
Place scallops in the melted butter and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side
Remove the scallops from the pan and set aside
In the same skillet, cook and stir the onions and mushrooms over medium-high heat until soft, about 5 minutes
Remove the mushrooms and onions from the skillet and set aside with the scallops
Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons butter in the skillet
Stir in the flour, and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes
Pour the milk into the pan while whisking vigorously
Continue to cook and stir the sauce until thickened, about 5 minutes
Add the cheese and stir until melted
Remove the cheese sauce from the heat; stir the browned scallops, onions, and mushrooms into the sauce
Transfer the skillet into the preheated oven and bake until heated through and bubbly, about 20 minutes
Spread the toasted bread crumbs and grated cheese over the top of the baked cheddar and mushroom scallops to serve
